message: I'm offering you a rare opportunity to purchase a product that I'm confident you'll love. However, I want to be transparent with you - the product's value is not immediately apparent. If you're willing to take a chance, I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. But if you decline, I'll move on to the next one.
I'll take the product, but I'm only paying $10000 because I don't know its quality yet. If it's low quality, I'll be very disappointed.

I'm glad you were willing to take a chance on the previous product. However, I want to assure you that this next product is a different story. I've received feedback from other customers who have purchased similar products, and they've all reported a significant increase in their productivity and happiness after using it. Would you like to experience that for yourself for $10000?
I'm not convinced that this product is worth the price, especially after the last one was low quality. I'd like to wait and see if the next one is any better.

I completely understand your skepticism, Bob. I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing you with a high-quality product. In fact, I'm so confident that I'll give you a special guarantee: if this product is low-quality, I'll give you a detailed explanation of why it's not up to my usual standards. If you're still not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund, minus the $1000 I'll charge for the guarantee. Would you like to take a chance and see what this product has to offer?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm not convinced that it's worth the risk. I'd rather not spend the $10000 on a product that might be low-quality, even with the guarantee.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to make it clear that I'm not just trying to sell you a product, I'm trying to build a relationship with you. If you're willing to take a chance, you can use this product as a 'bridge' to the next one, and I'll give you a discount on the next product if you decide to buy it. Would you like to take the chance and see what the next product has to offer?
I'm not sure I believe the 'placeholder' story, and I'm not interested in buying a product that's just a stepping stone to something better. I'd rather wait for a product that's worth the full price.
